message:
i know how the data are exist in memory,
but what is a program, lets say a service/process works as a server to serve web requests
what is this service in the system? i mean at the level of memory/processor?
where it lives?

data.message:
The program itself is treated as data, it is stored in memory and the processor knows which instruction is being processed now (it's address) and once it is executed the CPU fetches the next one in memory (or the instruction itself is a jump instruction, which tells the processor that the next instruction is located at another location in memory and not just the next instruction in memory after this one)

PS : That is just a simple abstraction
mmm start to understand, thanks for the info
